nodes.bodyText:
Does 0.+ mean any version of 0.x?
If so, how about 0+? Does this mean any version bigger than 0?

Yes.
But according to nannan, change like this still can't resolve the problem, looks like we can't have '+' anywhere in pom file.
So I change the version to a fixed one.

Please check this Declaring Versions and Ranges
A Maven-style version range: e.g. [1.0,), [1.1, 2.0), (1.2, 1.5]
The [ and ] symbols indicate an inclusive bound; ( and ) indicate an exclusive bound.
When the upper or lower bound is missing, the range has no upper or lower bound.
The symbol ] can be used instead of ( for an exclusive lower bound, and [ instead of ) for exclusive upper bound. e.g ]1.0, 2.0[

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	compile group: 'com.vmware.singleton', name: 'singleton-i18n-patterns-core', version: '0.5.1'
          
          
            
            	compile group: 'com.vmware.singleton', name: 'singleton-i18n-patterns-core', version: '[0,)'
